# Stream to Sea in School Program

## Tender Details
* Reference Number: cb-327-69379336
* Amendment Number: 1
* Solicitation Number: 30005627
* Publication Date: June 6, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: June 12, 2024 (2:00 PM)
* Amendment Date: June 12, 2024
* Expected Contract Start Date: August 1, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: July 31, 2025
* Tender Status: Expired

## Tender Overview
Fisheries and Oceans Canada is seeking Contractors to provide delivery and coordination services for the Stream to Sea Program. This program aims to develop opportunities for external parties to be involved in educating students and communities about salmon and their habitats.

The Contractor will be responsible for the following activities:

* Coordinating and delivering Stream to Sea Program services in schools and with local community groups
* Providing classroom incubation services, including technical support, equipment preparation, and egg delivery coordination
* Delivering classroom presentations and demonstrations to students and educators based on the DFO Stream to Sea Program resources
* Participating in the Fisheries and Oceans South Coast Area Education Team to review and update the SCA Education Program Delivery Plan

The Contractor will be expected to provide the following resources:

* A suitable vehicle for transporting equipment
* Personal field equipment
* Cell phone for communicating with teachers and DFO staff

## Program Requirements

The Stream to Sea Program aims to enhance education and community engagement in the following areas:

* Salmon and their life cycles
* Aquatic ecosystems and habitat requirements
* Environmental sustainability and conservation
* Stream to sea migration and other related topics

The Contractor will work closely with the Project Authority, including coordinating equipment setup, deliverables, and services.

## Contractual Requirements
The Contractor grants to Canada the irrevocable option to extend the term of the Contract by up to two (2) additional one-year periods under the same conditions.
